page.title: 04CONSERVATION IN S.W. LEEDS
page.content: Farnley Hall is the headquarters of the Tong Cockersdale Countryside Volunteers run by Bob Dawson, who is countryside warden for the area. Money to run the scheme is provided by Leeds, Bradford and West Yorkshire Councils, with help from the Countryside Commission. The scheme employs volunteers from schools and from the community as well as people on Youth Training programmes. Tasks include woodland management, footpath maintenance,liaison with local farmers and landowners. The warden and his team consider that educating the public in the sensible use of the countryside is an important aspect of their work. The area of open country managed by the TCCV lies partly within Farnley and forms a green wedge between the large urban areas of Leeds & Bradford.
